entry.et: Middle English prechen, from Anglo-French precher, from Late Latin praedicare, from Latin, to proclaim, make known, from prae- pre- + dicare to proclaim diction

def.dt: :to urge acceptance or abandonment of an idea or course of action
:to exhort in an officious or tiresome manner
:to set forth in a sermon preach the gospel
:to bring, put, or affect by preaching preached the … church out of debt American Guide Series: Virginia
